revised_title: Mass Transfer in Fluid Flow from a Solid Sphere: Experimental Study and Analysis
tldr: This study investigates the mass transfer from solid spheres in a fluid, focusing on the effects of forced convection. The authors conducted experiments using benzoic acid and water as the primary system, supporting the solid spheres from downstream. They found that the rate of mass transfer varies over the surface area of the sphere, with the downstream area becoming more effective at higher Reynolds numbers. The results provide data useful for predicting mass-transfer rates from solid surfaces and outside film coefficients in liquid-liquid extraction and gas absorption.
